Killing Floor - это история о том как я полюбил рок.
Killing Floor - это когда ты остаешься один на один с толпой мостров.
Killing Floor - это когда у тебя заканчиваются патроны и ты начинаешь убивать с ножа.
Killing Floor - это когда твои тиммейты заваривают дверь перед твоим носом.
Killing Floor - это когда твоя граната убивает тебя,но зомби остаются живы.
Killing Floor - это когда весело!

[h1]AT A GLANCE[/h1]
(Full review follows below)

[list]
[*] [b]Game Name:[/b] Killing Floor
[*] [b]Original Release:[/b] 2009
[*] [b]Genre Tags:[/b] FPS; Coop; Round-Based; Progressive 
[*] [b]My Overall Grade:[/b] A+
[*] [b]Estimated Playtime (Campaign):[/b] N/A
[*] [b]Multiplayer Aspect:[/b] Primary
[*] [b]Recommended To:[/b] Established fans of the genre; Those intrigued by the genre; Multiplayer gamers
[/list]	

[h1]REVIEW[/h1]
[b]Killing Floor[/b] is one of the most fun cooperative FPS games in existence. Team up with up to 5 other players to fight off waves of [strike]zombies[/strike] mutants. Not necessarily groundbreaking, but somehow the concept has been represented in a unique and entertaining way.  If you like cooperative FPS games, this should be a definite pick-up for you.

There are various types of mutants. Some are essentially “trash mobs,” but play a role in getting in the way. Then there are mid-tier and high-tier "specials" that all have unique attacks. These spawn less frequently, but can wind up overwhelming you if you don’t take them down quickly. And if you make it through all the waves in a match, there is a boss fight. If you play on the highest difficulty and with a full team, then these boss fights are easily among the most exciting and adrenaline-pumping boss fights in all of gaming.

There are 7 classes to play as.  You can play as all classes on your account, but only one at a time; and you will permanently level-up each class by playing.  Having higher levels is a must if you want to take on the higher difficulties.  On those high difficulties the true brilliance of the gameplay really shines. You’ll have to play smart and as a team if you want a chance to beat the maps on [i]Hell on Earth[/i]. It can be incredibly challenging, and you may go a while without winning a single match. But when you finally do, it can be incredibly satisfying.   

Having said that, it should be noted that the game also scales with the size of your team, and you can play solo which lowers the amount of enemies per wave and lowers their stats. Because of this, playing solo is actually easier for some, although if you make a single mistake it is game over because there is no one to pick up the slack. I personally feel the game is way more fun with full teams (and thus full enemy spawns with max stats).

Also, there is [i]a lot[/i] of DLC, but don't let that turn you off.  I have not bought a single DLC for this game, and have over 300 hours of fun and have nearly every achievement (except for two that I’m not worthy of).  That said, a couple of the DLCs are worth getting as they grant you access to some great weapons that are very effective and fun to use. And anyone who owns any DLC can drop the unlocked weapons in game for someone else to pick up for that match.

So if you like games like [i]Left 4 Dead[/i] or [i]Payday[/i], this is very much in the same vein. However, it also has a great unique identity. It is a sure bet for anyone who likes cooperative shooters and challenging gameplay.

This game is .... well I mean everyone else's reviews bascially say what I would say about it.

When you've sunk in about 400+ Hours it feels like one of those awesome games that have loads of awesome moments where you shred tons of zeds with an AA12 while seamlessly welding the door shut to bait another onslaught into the funnel.

I could tell you of the countless close calls and clutches I've pulled off by myself as a Sharpshooter, Berserker, or even a Medic too ...

 This game just has soo many wonderful memories for me and I have to say 20$ is worth the admission,

Its a shame that there isn't that many active multiplayer servers though but yeah .... this game is just good ole' coop fun.
If Quake was co-op, it would closely resemble Killing Floor. I prefer the Left 4 Dead games, but if you've got five friends who want to play this instead, 2 gigs are easy to leave installed.

1111 hours on record is as good a time as any to finally write an actual review for this.

I'll get the less interesting stuff out of the way first:
- The graphics are passable enough, with good customisation options that allow you to buy frames per second for some eye candy (mmm, candy!). I suppose it may look dated but I've never considered myself a graphics snob so it doesn't bother me.
- The sound effects are fine for the most part, the soundtrack is hit-or-miss based on what genres of music you like, I turned it off completely so I can hear what's happening around me because I prefer situational awareness to heavy metal.

Where the game shines is the gameplay.
That is if you're willing to invest some serious time in it as the learning curve is one of the most intricate ones I've seen. This is interesting considering the simplicity of the premise - there are two gamemodes (one of which only has 3 official maps and frankly I've always seen it as a mere gimmick), in the standard one the players fight 4, 7 or 10 waves of zombies (9 types with different strengths and weaknesses, some of which complement one another dangerously well) plus the same boss every time and that's it. That really sounds like it should get old quickly, yet somehow it doesn't - there's always new stuff to learn, skills to improve, weapon loadouts to try... I don't think anyone can honestly say "I know everything there is to know about KF".
A large portion of the advanced tricks and tactics I believe are actually a result of quirks in the code that weren't intentional but happened to make the game much more complex than it looks on the surface.
The downside to all this is that experienced players often have little tolerance for inexperienced ones who haven't figured out the ideal loadouts and strategies yet. It can be difficult to pick the game up now and start learning because people WILL insult you, votekick you etc, but it can be done - there are loads of guides explaining both the basics and the advanced stuff, and some experienced players like coaching newer ones and showing them the ropes. As long as you're willing to learn and don't act like a twæt, you should be fine.

So yeah, Killing Floor 1, while slowly growing old, is a gem of the FPS genre. It's definitely not for everyone but if you do get into it, you're in for many hours of good fun.

Though I have only been in possession of the game since 2013 (though I don't believe that would directly affect my game-play experience), I must say that it has (to say the least) an enormous amount of replay value - I mean, Tripwire incorporated a myriad of elegance in the game itself, through the elements that were implemented to the overall endeavor of success against the persistent onslaught of zeds. The game was somewhat difficult to comprehend initially, but once one adapts to the fast-paced, unpredictable nature of the zeds (as well as to the layouts of each map), the game is truly a playground of virtual perfection - a literal masterpiece. Trust me; this game is worth the money. I'd buy it, if I were you, but clearly, that isn't the case. In all seriousness, let me just say that I strongly advise those who take their time to read this lengthy review to buy this game, as it's incredibly time-consuming in the best of ways imaginable.

看我游戏时间，就不要从我这里得到很客观的评测了。
百度能搜到这个游戏的玩法和介绍，挺详细的，自己多看看了解下，我就不废话了，下面说点实际的。
DLC，人物的看你喜好买；武器类的，别买皮肤的，没用。请买补充武器的。
成就十分难解锁，官方是看时间开启成就的，然而有些成就十分奇怪，没有老手指导，你根本别想解。
自从出了2以后，已经不允许玩家自己建房了，所以现在正版和盗版没区别了，都要去游侠平台联机—我这么说你应该懂，到底自己该不该买了。
相比于2，像我这样，一众老玩家还是很喜欢1的。只是可惜正版服务器里玩的人很少了。
恩，到底要玩正版还是盗版，你自己掂量吧。

KILLING FLOOR i should have Writen this review years ago but never got around to it. you can say i was to busy playing the game ;) 

but yeah this game is great fun yes its getting a bit old but the amount of joy i personally get from this game is in big bundles with both friends and randoms. learning how to survive the Hellish world in groups of 6 and alone agains the hords that floods you. And the great feeling when i was able to solo a six man party alone when they died and i was left alone against hordes of them on the hardest difficulty and that feeling was quite amazing. so if you like a challange in a first person shooter horror survival game KILLING FLOOR is your game ~

1代玩多了2代一下子就不习惯了
从2代角度来看，1代确实有很多的不足之处。
比如典型的无限封门守单路，焊枪和治疗器的操作不协当。｛1代很多官方地图都有封门甚至不用封门都可以守单路的情况这一点2代就给补足了，2代很多官方地图都没有守单路的情况，都是四面八方的进攻很强调队伍的韧性。｝
1代没有奔跑功能，一遇到scfp发飙盯死了你基本上最高难度就是秒躺，这一点2代就好多了有个奔跑功能可以边跑边打。
1代比2代好一点的就是职业了。突击支援比2代强太多了。地图补给也很勤不会出现2代人间地狱难度那种时时刻刻都要关注弹药消耗的紧迫感。
练级用第三方图和按键精灵挂着也比2代快了一点。2代主要是你有输出助攻就有经验但是问题就是经验太长了刷到满级除了纵火爆破医疗都不容易。
1代医疗枪也不像2代那样有自带追踪医疗针的设定，遇到腿快的队友还真是不容易。
1代画风比2代黑暗不少，2代除了黑图都还是挺明亮的。
玩习惯了2代回来玩1代很多都不习惯了。
买2代送1代，求生之路2可以效仿一下。

Let me start out by saying this game used to be good, but it\'s out of it\'s time. If you want a game like this, you\'d be better off buying Left 4 Dead 2, it\'s basically the same except there are many more players playng it to this day. Not to mention that the workshop is a pain in the ass for Killing Floor, you had to leave your game, go back to it, and then leave again, then install the mod... Left 4 Dead 2 is just, click sub and it\'s done, you might only need to leave the game if it affects a script that doesn\'t initiate til you next start your game. Also, Left 4 Dead 2, has no DLC like KIlling Floor... you just payed 20 dollars for a game... and you only get 1/4 of the game... a massive portion of Killing Floor is DLC, Left 4 Dead 2 has no DLC, you buy it and it\'s yours, and you\'ve got that workshop so you can add more content. 

Quite simply, just don\'t buy this game, it\'s a waste of your money now...
Worth every penny. game is so well optimised i reckon a actual potato could run it.

Killing Floor - Однозначно в эту игру, стоит сыграть. Как хоррор я не буду игру оценивать, в КФ не ощущается хоррор вообще.

Здесь нет сюжета, но есть немало карт, долго проходить в соляного достаточно трудно, для упёртных геймеров сойдёт. Почему трудно играть в оригинальные карты, ИБО темень, в большенства карт.

Геймплейна, игра интересна, конечно может насторожить у неопытного геймера, что нет у игры прицела. Для опытных геймеров, не страшно играть без прицела. Многие наверно играли в Zero Tolleranse, или в doom 1,2 на dosе, проблем труда не составит. Самый эпик начинается зайдя в Мультиплеер. Множество карт, которые делают игроки. Про кооператив я не знаю что с ним, ибо 10 месяцов назад, не работал кооператив. Если играть штурмовиком не хочется, то есть 5 \'ЕСЛИ Я НЕ ОШИБАЮСЬ КЛАССОВ\'

Графика неплохая, да старенький unreal engine 2, не выдаёт супер графоуни. Для слабого железа игра идеальна оптимизированна. В некоторых картах в Мультипеере, игра может подлагивать.(

Звук неплох, не худшая озвучка персонажей на великий русский язык. Саунд неплох, и сочен.

Что в итоге имеем, старенький шутан, с мясным геймплеем, с приятной графикой, и жёстким саундтреком.

Всем привет, хочу рассказать об одной из своих любимых мультиплеерных игр.
Чем же игра отличается от других и какая она?
Killing Floor это шутер против зомби -других монстров.
Миссия игры всего одна - выжить, вам нужно продержаться несколько волн монстров, количество монстров и волн зависит от сложности.
Достоинства: Простой движок, различные виды оружие, развитие навыков персонажа.
Недостатки: Придется купить если хотите нормально поиграть.
